content: What popular board game involves trading resources such as brick, lumber, wool, grain, and ore to build roads, settlements, and cities?

The popular board game you're referring to is called "Settlers of Catan," also known simply as "Catan." In this game, players take on the role of settlers establishing colonies on the island of Catan. The game involves resource management, trading, and strategic development.

Players collect resources by settling near production locations on a hexagonal game board that is randomly generated at the start of each game. The five primary resources in the game are brick, lumber, wool, grain, and ore. These resources are used to build roads, settlements, cities, and other structures, as well as to purchase development cards that can provide various advantages.

One of the key aspects of the game is trading these resources with other players or through the use of港口（如果有）to acquire the specific resources needed to advance in the game. Strategic trading can be crucial for obtaining the right combination of resources to build and expand effectively.

The game continues until one player reaches a predetermined victory point target, which can be achieved through building settlements and cities, owning the longest road, or having the largest army, among other ways.

Settlers of Catan has gained a significant following worldwide due to its blend of strategy, resource management, and interaction between players. It has also inspired several expansions and spin-off games that add new elements and variations to the original gameplay.
